item.title: Exchanges with a friend
item.description: Recently, I had some discussions with a friend of mine. Let’s call this person X. In a tweet that I had recently posted, I expressed interest in knowing better the history of Tipu Sultan. I am interested in Indian history in general, that the politically controversial nature of Tipu’s legacy makes it worth knowing more about this topic. X had some strong opinions about this topic and X quickly started confronting me about it.

item.title: Court: Review
item.description: This is a film review of the film Court. This film has been around since 2014 but I just saw it. Follow the spoiler warnings and you can read this review without getting the film spoiled. What is it about? It is a courtroom drama created by some guy called Chaitanya Tamhane. The film tries very hard to show a realistic courtroom The film is also very much about race relations in the United States.

item.title: Get out: Review
item.description: I saw Get Out, a 2017 film by Jordan Peele. This film was recommended to me by TG. Follow the spoiler warnings and you can read this review without getting the film spoiled. What is it about? The film is written and directed by Jordan Peele, who is definitely on a prolonged high-point in his career since the last few years. His last few films have gotten numerous accolades and love from critics.

item.title: Nagarkirtan: Review
item.description: I recently came across a 2017 Bengali film called Nagarkirtan. This film was recommended to me by AP. The film is available on the streaming platform Hoichoi TV. The film is a beautiful work of art. I will clearly mark the point after which this post contains spoilers. What is it about? The film is written and directed by Kaushik Ganguly, who is famous for making movies about oppressed classes and sexualities.

item.title: Permutation City: Review
item.description: This is a spoiler-free book review of Permutation City. This book was written in 1994 by the Australian mathematician and writer Greg Egan. He has a very peculiar background, which is that of mathematics and programming. In mathematics, he is known for having solved a combinatorics problem. The problem is very easy to explain, there’s even this Quanta magazine article about it. What is it about? It is a fiction based on the theme of uploading one’s consciousness to a computer.

item.title: Why cry at how long the path of love is?
item.description: The following is my discussion about a ghazal written by the Urdu poet Mir Taqi Mir. But who is he? Mir Taqi Mir (1723-1810) was a contemporary of Mirza Ghalib operating in the city of Lucknow. He was one of the first Urdu poets and he has pretty much shaped the language itself. Of course comparisons will be made between Mir and Ghalib and Wikipedia even has this section about what Ghalib said about Mir.

item.title: Here cometh 2021
item.description: This is in continuation to a previous post, which you can read here. item.title: Death to my 2020-self
item.description: Yesterday, I was watching the Netflix show Death to 2020. It’s a funny mockumentry with a stellar starcast about a horrible year that will be over soon. Watch the trailer here. It is up to anyone’s guess what 2021 will be like, but by all means it is very difficult for the coming year to be worse than what it was. Personally, it was a horrible year for myself too. With the pandemic spreading, I joined Twitter to keep up with all the developments and quickly developed opinions about Indian politics and climate change, some of which I will consider quite radical now.
